definition: to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to eat one's fill/to be full
to fill one's belly before the battle (idiom)

sentences.english: He said he fed them three square meals.
sentences.chinese: 他還稱每天爲孩子們提供三頓飽餐。

sentences.english: He washed himself, and ate a hearty meal .
sentences.chinese: 他洗了一把臉，然後飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: We feasted for weeks on the deer that daddy shot.
sentences.chinese: 我們接連數週飽餐了父親獵得的鹿肉。
當天，他美美地飽餐了一頓。

sentences.english: Sometime all full with feasting on your sight.
sentences.chinese: 有時飽餐秀色後膩到化不開。

sentences.english: Have you watched a cat who is trying to catch something tasty for dinner?
sentences.chinese: 觀察過貓抓獵物以飽餐一頓嗎？

sentences.english: the boa constrictor, when he has had an adequate meal , goes to sleep, and does not wake until he needs another meal.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟒飽餐一頓後就睡覺，直到需要再喫一頓時才醒來。

sentences.english: We ate to our heart ' s content at her home last Sunday .
sentences.chinese: 我們上星期天在她家飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: The flesh of a deer used as food.
sentences.chinese: 我們接連數週飽餐了父親獵得的鹿肉。

sentences.english: Eg . There was a time when we could get a good meal for less than 1 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 曾經有個時候我們不用花1元錢就能飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: But she will return to feast upon the trophy at her leisure.
sentences.chinese: 等空閒時它會回來飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: Grab a piece of your favorite meal and stay quiet after that?
sentences.chinese: 抓起你最喜愛的美食飽餐一頓，然後靜靜地呆在那裏？

sentences.english: And after that he had finished, the merchant led him to the guest-chamber, bade him sleep and be at rest.
sentences.chinese: 待他飽餐之後，商人領他去了客房，請他安睡歇息。

sentences.english: First, grab the chicken to catch fish, a hearty meal lush farm lunch.
sentences.chinese: 首先去抓雞捉魚，飽餐了一頓豐美的農家午餐。

sentences.english: Papaya cream is a nice final touch for any hearty meal.
sentences.chinese: 木瓜奶昔配黑加侖力嬌酒是飽餐後的完美點綴。

sentences.english: He has been repeatedly jailed and then released, each time going immediately to a restaurant and ordering lavishly.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜幾度進宮，每次釋放都要立即去飯店飽餐一頓。

definition: to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
